div.p: 1. V:5.— Bath in Potowmack alone— 5 minutes.

list.item: Leonard— For Clerkship in the Treasury. Left recoms: there

list.head: Mayor of Alexandria— Come to urge that the Penitentiary should be there. Comms. from abroad.
list.item: Roberts.
Wertz— To vindicate his character. Has left his wife— M’Manus.
Hamilton— Late Collector at Pensacola— Visit t.t.l.

list.head: From Frederick Maryland. Come to see the City, from curiosity.
list.item: David
Rush— S.T. Subscription to Louisville and Portland Canal Stock.

div.p: 2. IV:30. College Hill— No Bath.

list.item: Eadus. of Sodus N.Y. Claim for property destroyed last War.
King of Navy-yard— Dock finished there. To visit the yard.
Vandeventer— With lists of Comms. under Acts of last Session
Hay— G. Here as witness on a trial in circuit Court. Unwell
Giberson— G. L— with application for pardon to J. Gusti.
Roberdeau. Coll. Chronometers— E. Blunt’s complaints N.Y.
Wertz. With certificates to indicate his character
Bailey J. For Kirby’s Commissions— Going on Sunday.

div.p: 3. IV:15. To the rock. Foot-bath. Sun rose 4.39.— Faht. 92

list.item: Roberdeau— Coll. with Chronometer. Hardy. Observn. taken.
Elgar— Workman at Capitol, struck for more than $1.50.

div.p: 4. IV:20— Boat. with John, Antoine. George swam [symbols]

list.item: Heard Hawley. Romans 15.4.
Baron Stow at Baker’s— James 5:19.20— Light Shower.
Evening ride in Carriage— Mrs Adams, Johnson Hellen— C. F. A.
Fahrenheit 92. Heat oppressive.

div.p: 5. IV:20. Boat with John & George. Swam an hour

list.item: Southard. S.N. Returned from Baltimore— Ashmun’s despatches.
Hay. George. Pascal and Montesquieu
Pleasonton. S. How to answer S. Clarke’s abuse? By Silence
Roberdeau— Coll. I. with the two Telescopes
Simons— for an Appointment— in great want.

list.head: Stone-cutters for an increase of wages. Claim an average between Baltimore & N.Y.

list.item: Van de Venter— Berrien applies to see Genl. Gaines’s Journal.
Clay. S.S. From Baltimore. Engaged on Gallatin’s Instructions
Huntt. Dr. H. Site of the Penitentiary— Greenleaf’s point.
Lightning Struck S.W. Chimney of Dr. Lovell’s House

div.p: 6. V.5. Rock— Swam alone 20 minutes.

list.item: Van de Venter— Answer. Secy. War to Govr Murphy of Alabama—
Graham. G. Choctaw School Land Reservation. The funds
Weightman R. C. For Corpn. Committee Resns. Navy-Yard Disbursemts.
Hay. G. The negro woman gives up her suit and goes back.
Simms— Mrs: with recommendations of pardon for her Son.
Criddle— Jonathan— Crazy Mechanician— Rambling talk
Signed 255. Blanks Alabama and Mississippi— Credit

div.p: 7. IV:20— Swam 5 minutes in Potowmack alone

list.item: Brown— Genl.— Convalescent. G. Morris. J. Armstrong. Mr Monroe
Rush. S.T— Papers. Navy-Hospital Chelsea— G. M. Bibb’s Accounts
Wirt. W. His opinion, on assignment of rank to be revised
Examined first Volume of Executive Journal.
100 Blank— Illinois Land-grants
Signed 30 Blank single patents— 28 left.
From 10. May to 6. June 33 issued.
Telescope view of Mars

div.p: 8. IV:30. Sun rose 4:37— Foot-bath at the Rock.

list.item: Huntt. Rept. of Commrs. to Select a Penitentiary spot.

list.head: Doctors on visits of curiosity
of Maryland
of Pennsylvania

list.item: Rush. S.T— G. M. Bibb— Kentucky State Bank paper.
Wirt. W— Further Examination of Journals 1797–1801.
Signed— Missouri Blank. Land-grants 101.

div.p: 9. IV:15. Sun rose 4:37— Boat with John & George. Swam 30 [symbols]

list.item: Southard S.N. J. Q. A. Boyd at Boston— Purchase of Ship at N.Y.
Rush. S.T— Claim of Nevins. of Shipment of Teas by. E. Thomson

list.head: With papers, urging that we should give up 51000 dollars of Thomson’s importations
list.item: Nevins
Sewall. Dr. Columbian College debt. Baptist Convention pledge
Dinsmoor— Survey of Mobile Harbour. G. Davis & public papers.
Roberdeau’s— Misses in the Evening— Piano and Song.

div.p: 10. IV:20. Sun rose 4:37. Boat with [symbols] swam 45 [symbols]

list.item: Weightman— with Lottery City Resolution and another
Parker— D. now from Philadelphia. visitor.
Boudinot. Elias. Cherokee— Contribution for printing press
Walker— Applicant for appointment.
Allen W. W.— a Preacher from Cambridge in distress & ill health
Rush— S.T, Marine Hospital Boston— Nevins’s papers to Atty. Genl.
Clay S.S— Closing Instructions for A. Gallatin— Annapolis excursion.
Southard S.N— The Ship at N. York. Letter from Taliaferro
Stokes, of Ga. for James Belfield to be discharged.
Telescope view of Jupiter.

div.p: 11. IV:10. Sun rose 4:36— Boat [symbols] crossed river, swam 30 [symbols]

list.item: Heard Walton at Baker’s 2. Cor: 5.1.
Same Afternoon. Hosea 9–12.
John and Charles went and dined at D. Brent’s.
Gust of Wind— Thunder heard remote.
Peters. Richard junr— Evening here.

div.p: 12. IV. Sun rose 4:36— Boat [symbols] Swam 45 [symbols] Cool.

list.item: Heard Judge Cranch’s introductory Lecture— course of Law
Dickins, Asbury— Pamphlet from Hassler, 4. July celebration
Walker Dudley— For Purser’s Office— Took his papers.
Rush. S.T— Letter to Wirt. A.G. concerning case of Nevins
Vandeventer. Berrien, asks copy of Gaines’s journal. Refer to S.W.
Elgar. J— informed him Commrs for Penitentiary had reported
Mary Roberdeau. R. Peters and D. Walker dined with us.

div.p: 13. IV. Sun rose 4:35.— Boat. Swam 45 minutes [symbols]

list.item: Hagner. P— Randall of Annapolis died last Eve. appln. for his Son
Anderson. Jos— To recommend C. M’lean Supert of Penitentiary.
Southard. Frigate at N. York. Letters from Stockton. Meeting N.J.
Rush S.T. Nevins’s case— Missed A.Gl. opinion.
Graham— G— Indian funds in name of P.U.S. Seneca’s. Choctaws
Clay. S.S. Instructions to A. Gallatin, prepared. Meeting tomorrow.

list.head: Norris married E. Thomson’s daughter. Solicits for his release from Prison. objections more than insolvent
list.item: Southard
Huntt— Dr. Informs me I have Erysipelas
Mrs. Adams dined at her brother T. B. J’s— Mary Hellen unwell.
Saw eclipse of Jupiter’s first Satellite at 9:40. in the Evening. by emersion— No reappearance. Extraordinary aspect of the Moon through the glass.

div.p: 14. IV:30. Sun rose 4:35. Walk to the College

list.head: Of Alexandria. Friends. wish for appointment of Saml. H. Parsons. supert. of penitentiary. Friends

list.item: Passett— To complain of his partner Fadevilhe.
Wertz— For his commn. as Justice of the Peace

list.head: Told me of the threats of Pennsylvanian members of Congress, unless Coll. Chambers be restored
Visitors from Norfolk. Newton a brother of the member. H.R.— going back to-morrow.

list.item: Brown. Genl. About Coll. R. Jones, Coll. Nourse and Clinton N.Y.

list.head: Cabinet Meeting. Instructions to A. Gallatin Right of Navigating the St. Lawrence— Mr Clay unwell— Mr Southard goes to Annapolis to-morrow
list.item: Clay. S.S.
Rush. S.T.
Southard S.N
Elgar— Of the pay of the Stone-cutters. Returned to their work
Bulfinch— Returned from N.Y. did not go to Auburn— Will Report.
Wilson of La.— Claim of an Account which I did not admit.
Mr and Mrs Southard here this Evening with their daughter.
Mary Hellen ill.

div.p: 15. IV:15— Sun rose 4:35. Walk to the Capitol.

list.item: Brent. D. brought despatches from A. H. Everett— Coyle’s Letter.
Law. T. Approves Appointment of Cary Selden.

list.head: Cabinet Meeting— Instructions to A. Gallatin. discussed and determined— Letter from Wirt.
list.item: Clay. S.S.
Rush. S.T

div.p: 16. IV:30. Cloudy— Walk 1 hour 15 minutes

list.item: Davis— Gideon. Applying for S. P. Parsons— to erect Penitentiary.

list.head: Prentiss knew me in London in 1783. 4. Now lives in the Western part of Virginia
list.item: Prentiss.

list.head: For payment for Surveys— Act of 3. March 1819. Sec: 11— Disagreements with Davis

list.item: Bomford. Coll. G.— Recommends [Leckie]— Forest Trees. Lead mines.

div.p: 17. IV:20.— Cloudy. Sprinkling— The House Square 21 minutes. Walk an hour 10 minutes.

list.item: Conner. Benjamin— To be employed for the dry dock. Portsmouth
Truair— Revd. John— Agent for Seamen’s Friend Society.
Wertz— Read to him the charges in Coyle’s Letter— denied by him
Lovell Dr— From Todson— Surgeon Cashiered. To revise Court Martial.
Brent. D. With remonstrance against appointment of Wertz
Dickins. A— Invitation to Ex-Presidents to 4. July celebration.
Munroe— T. Application for an Appt. for Kelty. Weary of his own Office.

div.p: Heavy Rain, continued the whole day and confined me to the House— I was not very well— And having a seeming day of leisure, I wasted it in consultations of Michaux’s Silva Americana—and Nicholson’s Encyclopaedia, and Gregory’s Dictionary upon the construction of watches— Also in preparing a list of French Books to be sent to Mr Brown, our Minister at Paris to be procured for the Department of State— The day was gone before I had time to enquire how it had passed— Towards evening, without clearing up the weather became sultry.
19. IV:15. Sultry. Walk round Capitol Square— Trees.

list.item: Beddo— Applies for Admission of Wellmore at West-Point.
Bashford. Mrs. To build a shop at the Penitentiary ground
Lee W: to recommend Leckie for building penitentiary.
Rush— Wirt’s opinion upon the Nevins claim— Geyer’s Letter.
Bainbridge. Come Returned from West-Point Examination.
Vandeventer. Application from Phila. Militia to occupy Fort Mifflin

list.head: Nelson, agent for Township of Land granted to the Kentucky Asylum. Instns. to Gallatin. Slave Comn.
list.item: Clay. S.S.
Watkins Dr— Letters from J. Barney— S. Smith & P. S. Markley.

div.p: 20. IV. Walk to capitol Square

list.item: Weightman— R. C. for Act of Washington Corporation. Police of U.S. Land
Southard— S.N. Returned last Evening from Annapolis
Dinsmoor. Silas— His nephews claims— referred to Gen Land-Office.
Vandeventer Major. Letter from Crowell. Georgia Bank Money.

list.head: To enquire concerning Eadus’s claim. Tharp gave his name with reluctance.
list.item: Tharp— Coll and
Vandeventer Major again. Treasury cannot accommodate him.
Evening— Mr and Mrs Clay, and Mr and Mrs. J. S. Johnston.

div.p: Mrs. Adams copied the drawing of the [Live] Oak twig in Michaux’s North American Sylva Vol 1. p 66.
21. IV:45. Solstice— Cloudy— Walk to Capitol— Michaux [symbols]

list.item: Elgar.— Of furnishing the floor of the great Hall. Penitenty.
Vandeventer. Bank money, in Georgia— Treasy. cannot supply

list.head: Contee formerly an Officer of Marines, now a farmer— Talk of live Oak and forest Trees
list.item: Contee of P. G. Co.
Wertz— concluded to postpone delivery of his Commn. on J. P—

list.head: Of Columbian College debts— Galusha to be the Treasurer— Baptist Convention engagements.
list.item: Sewall Dr. &
Coxe. Mayor Recommends Magruder as J.P.
Rush S.T— Correspondence concerning mulberry and Silk.
Todson. Dr. Complaints agt. Court Martial— To prepare Memorial [symbols]

div.p: 22. IV.— Walk to Capitol.— Twig of Maple

list.item: Pettis— Application for discharge of R. H. Speake. Asst. & Battery. decd
Eadus— For reference of his claim to the Atty Genl. absent
Rush S.T— Georgia Banks. No Surplus at Augusta, after 1 July.
Clay S.S. Going to Kentucky— Instructions to Gallatin finished—
Mary Hellen seized with a violent chill— Mrs Adams ill.

div.p: 23. IV:15. Walk to Capitol— Leaf of Tulip-tree—or Poplar.

list.item: Charles went for New-York.

list.head: Mr Cunningham with his wife and daughter— visit from Boston
list.item: King—Charles. B
Brent. D. Letter to Donna Isabella— Regent of Portugal
Southard— The Greek frigate. E. Everett. [Contestuvlo]— Bayard &c
Clay. Letter from A. Gallatin— Asks copies of all the papers under Commn. 5th. Article Treaty of Ghent
Mrs Smith & Mrs Frye.

div.p: 24. IV:40. Capitol. Sassafras—

list.item: Southard. Going this day to Fredericksburg for a week.
Charges agt. C Smith of Marine Corps.
Rush— Genl. Bernards Repts. Chesapeake & Delaware Canal.
Correspondence with the Directors— Their scruples.
Expediency of securing rights of U.S. hereafter.
Clay— Going to-morrow on a visit to Kentucky— Letter taking leave from Cañaz— Valero Chargé d’Affaires—
Boyle to be Dist. Judge US. Kentucky.
Speake Mrs for discharge of her Son from prison— declined.

div.p: 25. IV. Round the Square 21 minutes: White Maple— Yellow Birch—

list.item: Heard Little. 2. Cor. 13.9. We wish your perfection.
Baker. Psalm 119.89. word settled in Heaven— Showery
Little 1. Peter 3.15. Defence of Christianity [vs] Schulze & Smith
Mr Clay left the City on a visit to Kentucky.

div.p: 26. IV:40. Southeast Storm— Cleared off 8. A.M.

list.item: Elliot. Richard to be Superintendent for building Penitentiary.
Coxe for claim of Alexander Scott. decies repetita
Walker. Dudley— for Appointment of purser in Navy. S.N. absent
Roberdeau Coll.— Examination of the Dollond Telescope.

div.p: 27. IV. Sun rose 4:34— By my Chronometer 4:39.40

list.item: Barbour. S.W. Returned this Morning from Virginia

list.head: Visitors.
list.item: Lee— Archibd
Henry— Commissions of legal Enquiry.
Addison. Revd W. for name and subscription for educating young men to the Episcopal Church.
Order to discharge George Allen from prison. Manslaughter.

div.p: 28: IV:20— Sun darkened by a Cloud as rising

list.item: Foy— Planter of Trees at the Capitol and here

list.head: Again upon the claim for teas to the Amount of $51000, in Thomson’s Ships— Importunities

list.item: Gray. Mrs. For release from a judgmt of Circt Court. Coloured
Forrest. R. with Holbach’s Exequatur to be changed.
Brent. D. with —— Gave Brent Mrs Gray’s papers.
Heineken. C. A. Consul of Bremen at Baltimore

div.p: 29. IV:20. Sun beclouded— Rock— Swam 20 minutes

list.item: Barbour S.N— Execution of intl. improvement Laws.
Swain Levi— To be Cadet— No vacancy in his district—
Rush— Letters from C. J. Ingersoll and Binns.
Thompson William. Wounded Seaman has a pension

div.p: 30. IV.35. Sun beclouded rising— Rock. Swam 25 minutes

list.item: Swann— [Anna] & H. Gray— disorderly house— Mrs Speake’s Son—
[El]gar— Payment of Stone-cutters to-morrow. Penitentiary.
Strickland. W— to make Hall of H.R. audible— Letters from Peters & St.

list.head: Returning to Portsmouth. wishes employment. The Son Master of a Vessel just from the Havaña.
list.item: Conner Captn
Rush— with Mulberry leaves— 3 kind— S. Clarke. Tharp.
Bulfinch. C. Plan of Penitentiary. Stone-cutters wages to be 1:75

list.head: For the Stone Cutters. brought Letters from N. York and Boston— wages from 1:75 to 2 dollars a day.

list.item: Baker— Daniel— Eve— with apology from Revd. Mr Nevins
Mary Hellen seized with a chill at dinner.
Weightman R. C. the Mayor
